pullRequest.body:
To match `pow_eq_pow_mod` for monoids.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Also beautify the proof of `pow_eq_pow_mod` (thanks Riccardo!) and add a hybrid `zpow_eq_zpow_mod`.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks!

bors d+

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

This seems very confusing, we both have [Int.instModInt](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.instModInt) and [Int.instModInt_1](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Std/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.instModInt_1), and I am afraid `%` uses one or the other depending on who know what.

Wooah yeah it does seem to be `emod`! I don't want this lemma in practice, I only need the primed corollary (when we're dividing by an int coerced from a nat), and my recollection is that there the two choices are the same. I've changed the names to emod. Well spotted :-)
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8069550025/job/22044818914)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8069550025/job/22044819452)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8069550025/job/22044819970)

It seems that it actually uses [Int.emod](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Std/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.emod), so you may want to check it is the version you want (and change the name)...

It seems that it actually uses [Int.emod](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Std/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.emod), so you may want to check it is the version you want (and change the name)...

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion x ^ m = x ^ (m % n) := by ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion x ^ m = x ^ (m % (n : ℤ)) := zpow_eq_zpow_zmod m (by simpa) ```

```suggestion
    _ = x ^ (m % n) := by simp [zpow_add, zpow_mul, h]
```
I'm not sure if zmod is the right name for this, but I don't have any other suggestions either.
This `%` is [Int.mod](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.mod) right? In this case the convention seems to just use `mod`.
Oh thanks! In which case maybe I'll go for `mod` and `mod'`.

```suggestion
theorem zpow_eq_zpow_mod {x : G} (m : ℤ) {n : ℤ} (h : x ^ n = 1) :
    x ^ m = x ^ (m % n) :=
  calc
    x ^ m = x ^ (m % n + n * (m / n)) := by rw [Int.emod_add_ediv]
    _ = x ^ (m % n) := by simp [zpow_add, zpow_mul, h]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/GroupPower/Basic): add zpow_eq_zpow_zmod

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

It seems that it actually uses [Int.emod](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Std/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.emod), so you may want to check it is the version you want (and change the name)...

This seems very confusing, we both have [Int.instModInt](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.instModInt) and [Int.instModInt_1](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Std/Data/Int/Basic.html#Int.instModInt_1), and I am afraid `%` uses one or the other depending on who know what.

Wooah yeah it does seem to be `emod`! I don't want this lemma in practice, I only need the primed corollary (when we're dividing by an int coerced from a nat), and my recollection is that there the two choices are the same. I've changed the names to emod. Well spotted :-)
bors r+
